dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
HiCOPS is a software framework for accelerating database peptide search
workflows on supercomputers. HiCOPS provided algorithm-independent
parallelizations and optimizations can be extended into new HPC database
search algorithms or scalably accelerate the existing ones.
dependent_to.name: hicops

dependent_to.description:
OpenMolcas is a quantum chemistry software package. The key feature of
OpenMolcas is the multiconfigurational approach to the electronic
structure.
dependent_to.name: openmolcas

dependent_to.description: A clock-driven simulator for spiking neural networks
dependent_to.name: py-brian2

dependent_to.description: Library for retrieving information about catkin packages.
dependent_to.name: py-catkin-pkg

dependent_to.description:
Creation and manipulation of parameter configuration spaces for
automated algorithm configuration and hyperparameter tuning.
dependent_to.name: py-configspace

dependent_to.description: Common workflow language reference implementation
dependent_to.name: py-cwltool

dependent_to.description: Git for data scientists - manage your code and data together.
dependent_to.name: py-dvc

dependent_to.description: Galaxy Generic Utilities
dependent_to.name: py-galaxy-util

dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms
dependent_to.name: py-goatools

dependent_to.description:
Grandalf is a Python package made for experimentations with graph
drawing algorithms.
dependent_to.name: py-grandalf

dependent_to.description: A comprehensive HTTP client library.
dependent_to.name: py-httplib2

dependent_to.description: Python API for LVIS dataset.
dependent_to.name: py-lvis

dependent_to.description:
Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating static, animated, and
interactive visualizations in Python.
dependent_to.name: py-matplotlib

dependent_to.description:
Blue Brain Nexus Forge is a domain-agnostic, generic and extensible
Python framework enabling non-expert users to create and manage
knowledge graphs.
dependent_to.name: py-nexusforge

dependent_to.description:
The oslo.utils library provides support for common utility type
functions, such as encoding, exception handling, string manipulation,
and time handling.
dependent_to.name: py-oslo-utils

dependent_to.description: Core utilities for Python packages.
dependent_to.name: py-packaging

dependent_to.description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.
dependent_to.name: py-periodictable

dependent_to.description:
A source-to-source Fortran compiler designed to programmatically
optimise, parallelise and instrument HPC applications (written in
Fortran) via user- provided transformation scripts. Additionally,
PSyclone supports the development of kernel-based, Fortran-embedded DSLs
and is used in the UK Met Office's next-generation modelling system,
LFRic.
dependent_to.name: py-psyclone

dependent_to.description: Python interface to Graphviz's Dot language
dependent_to.name: py-pydot

dependent_to.description: Python interface to Graphviz's Dot
dependent_to.name: py-pydot2

dependent_to.description: Python interface to Graphviz's Dot language
dependent_to.name: py-pydotplus

dependent_to.description:
Rasterio reads and writes geospatial raster data. Geographic information
systems use GeoTIFF and other formats to organize and store gridded, or
raster, datasets. Rasterio reads and writes these formats and provides a
Python API based on N-D arrays.
dependent_to.name: py-rasterio

dependent_to.description:
RDFLib is a pure Python package for working with RDF. RDFLib contains
most things you need to work with RDF, including: parsers and
serializers for RDF/XML, N3, NTriples, N-Quads, Turtle, TriX, Trig and
JSON-LD (via a plugin). a Graph interface which can be backed by any one
of a number of Store implementations store implementations for in-memory
storage and persistent storage on top of the Berkeley DB a SPARQL 1.1
implementation - supporting SPARQL 1.1 Queries and Update statements
dependent_to.name: py-rdflib

dependent_to.description: Snuggs are s-expressions for Numpy
dependent_to.name: py-snuggs

dependent_to.description: A Python library to create SVG drawings.
dependent_to.name: py-svgwrite

dependent_to.description: Graph Neural Network Library for PyTorch.
dependent_to.name: py-torch-geometric

dependent_to.description:
Survey is a high level performance tool product from Trenza, Inc. The
survey collector/analytics framework is a new generation, high level,
lightweight multiplatform Linux tool set that targets metric collection
for high level performance analysis of applications running on both
single node and on large scale platforms, including the Cray platforms.
The collector is designed to work on sequential, MPI, OpenMP, and hybrid
codes and directly leverages several interfaces available for tools
inside current MPI implementations including: MPICH, MVAPICH, MPT, and
OpenMPI. It also supports multiple architectures and has been tested on
machines based on Intel, AMD, ARM, and IBM P8/9 processors and
integrated AMD and NVIDIA GPUs. Survey is a licensed product with the
source not openly available. To access the survey source and build with
spack please contact: Trenza Inc. via: dmont@trenzasynergy.com or
jeg@trenzasynergy.com
dependent_to.name: survey

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
